acceptance-test-run.title: Podam should handle both native and wrapped float values with @PodamFloatValue annotation
acceptance-test-run.name: podamShouldHandleFloatValuesWithThePodamFloatValueAnnotation

test-step.description: When I invoke the factory manufacturing for <span class='step-parameter'>class uk.co.jemos.podam.test.dto.annotations.FloatValuePojo

Then the Object FloatRangeValuesPojo ( floatFieldWithMinValueOnly = 0.0 floatFieldWithMaxValueOnly = 70.183586 floatFieldWithMinAndMaxValue = 33.774216 floatFieldWithPreciseValue = 123456.0 floatObjectFieldWithMinValueOnly = 0.0 floatObjectFieldWithMaxValueOnly = 26.698914 floatObjectFieldWithMinAndMaxValue = 719.4529 floatObjectFieldWithPreciseValue = 123456.0 ) should not be null
Then the Float value 0.0 should be greater or equal than 0.0
Then the float value 70.183586 should be lower or equal than 100.0
Then the float value 33.774216 should be between 0.0 and 1000.0
Then the Object 0.0 should not be null
Then the Float value 0.0 should be greater or equal than 0.0
Then the Object 26.698914 should not be null
Then the float value 26.698914 should be lower or equal than 100.0
Then the Object 719.4529 should not be null
Then the float value 719.4529 should be between 0.0 and 1000.0
Then the float value 123456.0 should be precisely 123456.0
Then the Object 123456.0 should not be null
Then the float value 123456.0 should be precisely 123456.0
